items.label: Approach
items.text: we propose MSCCD (Multilingual Syntactic Code Clone Detector), a grammar pluggable code clone detection tool that uses a parser generator to generate a code block extractor for the target language. The extractor then extracts the semantic code blocks from a parse tree. MSCCD can detect Type-3 clones at various granularities.

items.label: Approach
items.text: every subtree in a parse tree (PT) presents a semantic code block

items.label: Approach
items.text: MSCCD generates a code block extractor

items.label: Approach
items.text: To detect clones, we adopted the definition and algorithm proposed by SourcererCC

items.label: Experiment
items.text: To evaluate the performance of MSCCD, we conducted experiments to answer the following research questions:

items.label: Experiment
items.text: We evaluated the most popular 21 languages according to the PYPL ranking.

items.label: Experiment
items.text: For each language, we randomly selected five files with more than ten lines from the Rosetta Code.

items.label: Experiment
items.text: We measured the recall of MSCCD by using Big-CloneEval

items.label: Threats
items.text: An external threat exists regarding the language extensibility of MSCCD.

items.label: Threats
items.text: Users must confirm that the used grammar definition file is executable in ANTLRv4 and that it matches the version with the target files.

items.label: Threats
items.text: One internal threat is that we did not report the precision of different languages.
